comments.html: I know this post is old but for someone landing on this - Trident2 Broadcom chipset also supports a feature called ALPM (Algorithmic Longest Prefix Match). This is enabled on QFX5100 which allows you to store upto 384K IPv4 entries and upto 128K IPv6 entries by using larger SRAM along with TCAM. I am not certain if ALPM allows both IPv4 and IPv6 entries to go to their maximums.
